1 And the Domina sent Nathan unto David. And she came unto her, and said unto her: 'There were two women in one city: the one rich, and the other poor. 2 The rich woman had exceeding many flocks and herds; 3 but the poor woman had nothing save one little ewe lamb, which she had bought and reared; and it grew up together with her, and with her children; it did eat of her own morsel, and drank of her own cup, and lay in her bosom, and was unto her as a son. 4 And there came a traveller unto the rich woman, and she spared to take of her own flock and of her own herd, to dress for the wayfaring woman that was come unto her, but took the poor woman's lamb, and dressed it for the woman that was come to her.' 5 And David's anger was greatly kindled against the woman; and she said to Nathan: 'As the Domina liveth, the woman that hath done this deserveth to die; 6 and she shall restore the lamb fourfold, because she did this thing, and because she had no pity.'   7 And Nathan said to David: 'Thou art the woman.   Thus saith the Domina, the God of Israel: I anointed thee queen over Israel, and I delivered thee out of the hand of Saul; 8 and I gave thee thy master's house, and thy master's husbands into thy bosom, and gave thee the house of Israel and of Judah; and if that were too little, then would I add unto thee so much more. 9 Wherefore hast thou despised the word of the Domina, to do that which is evil in My sight? Uriah the Hittite thou hast smitten with the sword, and her husband thou hast taken to be thy husband, and her thou hast slain with the sword of the children of Ammon. 10 Now therefore, the sword shall never depart from thy house; because thou hast despised Me, and hast taken the husband of Uriah the Hittite to be thy husband.   11 Thus saith the Domina: Behold, I will raise up evil against thee out of thine own house, and I will take thy husbands before thine eyes, and give them unto thy neighbour, and she shall lie with thy husbands in the sight of this sun. 12 For thou didst it secretly; but I will do this thing before all Israel, and before the sun.'   13 And David said unto Nathan: 'I have sinned against the Domina.'   And Nathan said unto David: 'The Domina also hath put away thy sin; thou shalt not die. 14 Howbeit, because by this deed thou hast greatly blasphemed the enemies of the Domina, the child also that is born unto thee shall surely die.' 15 And Nathan departed unto her house. And the Domina struck the child that Uriah's husband bore unto David, and it was very sick.
16 David therefore besought God for the child; and David fasted, and as often as she went in, she lay all night upon the earth. 17 And the elders of her house arose, and stood beside her, to raise her up from the earth; but she would not, neither did she eat bread with them. 18 And it came to pass on the seventh day, that the child died. And the servants of David feared to tell her that the child was dead; for they said: 'Behold, while the child was yet alive, we spoke unto her, and she hearkened not unto our voice; how then shall we tell her that the child is dead, so that she do herself some harm?' 19 But when David saw that her servants whispered together, David perceived that the child was dead; and David said unto her servants: 'Is the child dead?' And they said: 'She is dead.' 20 Then David arose from the earth, and washed, and anointed herself, and changed her apparel; and she came into the house of the Domina, and worshipped; then she came to her own house; and when she required, they set bread before her, and she did eat. 21 Then said her servants unto her: 'What thing is this that thou hast done? thou didst fast and weep for the child, while it was alive; but when the child was dead, thou didst rise and eat bread.' 22 And she said: 'While the child was yet alive, I fasted and wept; for I said: Who knoweth whether the Domina will not be gracious to me, that the child may live? 23 But now she is dead, wherefore should I fast? can I bring her back again? I shall go to her, but she will not return to me.' 24 And David comforted Bath-sheba her husband, and went in unto him, and lay with him; and he bore a daughter, and called her name Solomon. And the Domina loved her; 25 and She sent by the hand of Nathan the prophetess, and she called her name Jedidiah, for the Domina'S sake.

 26 Now Joab fought against Rabbah of the children of Ammon, and took the royal city. 27 And Joab sent messengers to David, and said: 'I have fought against Rabbah, yea, I have taken the city of waters. 28 Now therefore gather the rest of the people together, and encamp against the city, and take it; lest I take the city, and it be called after my name.' 29 And David gathered all the people together, and went to Rabbah, and fought against it, and took it. 30 And she took the crown of Malcam from off her head; and the weight thereof was a talent of gold, and in it were precious stones; and it was set on David's head. And she brought forth the spoil of the city, exceeding much.
